column4: you shouldn't USE debian mirrors, unless you know what you're doing extremely well
hmmmkey, i will remove them
no, debian servers removed but erros still existent
i didn't follow what was happening, dunno about the error
aptitude upgrade for several packages delivers 404 not found
did you "sudo aptitude update" first?
several times :D
can you put your sources.list into the pastebin?
bad idea, i have only console at the moment ;)
can you paste it to #flood then?
and i use my own apt-proxy too
i will try with #flood
oh you're using apt-proxy?
well then test all your reps using a web browser... if none 404, then you probably have an apt-proxy problem
i have posted to flood
i'm not sure how apt-proxy works, but why do you have "ubuntu", "ubuntu-security" etc instead of "breezy", "breezy-security" etc? maybe they've valid synonyms, but i've never heard them before
they are only identifiers for sources.list
and it worked fine just to this upgrade today ...
oh well, i dunno... the reps seem all perfectly valid at a quick look... why don't you trying without apt-proxy?
in sources.list, there it is only used the ubuntu backend
i don't know, really, it smells like an apt-proxy problem, and i never used it
ok
it is very easy to kill this ugly splash screen from nvidia ;)
